title: JESUS, MY LORD, MY GOD, MY ALL

content: Sweet Sacrament, You we adore;
Oh, make us love you more and more
Jesus, My Lord, My God, my all,
How can I love you as I ought?
And how revere this wondrous gift?
So far suppressing hope or thoughts?
Had I but Mary's sinless heart
To love You with, my dearest King,
Oh, with what bursts of fervent praise
Your goodness, Jesus, would I sing!
Sweet Sacrament, etc.
Ah see! Within a creature's hand
The vast Creator designs to be
Reposing infant-like, as though
On Joseph's arm, or Mary's knee
Sweet Sacrament, etc.
Your body, soul, and Godhead, all:
O mystery of love divine!
I cannot compass all I have
For all you have and all are mine,
Sweet Sacrament, etc.
Sound, sound His praises higher still,
And come, ye angels, to our aid;
'Tis God, 'tis God, the very God
Whose power man and angels made.
Sweet Sacrament, etc
